node.title: 'Disturbing': Outrage after Christian school threatens to expel students over sexual orientation and gender identity
node.description: 88,000 people have signed a petition demanding a recall of the contract.
node.content: ["A Christian college in Brisbane has been criticized after it required parents to sign a new contract with clauses around their child's sexual orientation and gender identity.", "Citipointe Christian College released a \"declaration of faith\" contract that could see children expelled for expressing any sexual orientation outside of heterosexuality or being openly transgender.", "The school sent out the updated enrollment contract to parents just over a week ahead of schools returning.", "\"We believe that any form of sexual immorality, (including but not limited to adultery, fornication, homosexual acts, bisexual acts, bestiality, incest, paedophilia and pornography), is sinful and offensive to God and is destructive to human relationships and society,\" the document states.", "It states the college will only enroll a student \"on the basis of the gender that corresponds to their biological sex\" and has \"the right to exclude a student\" who \"no longer adheres to the College's doctrinal precepts including those as to biological sex\".", "At the time of publication, more than 88,000 people have signed a petition demanding a recall of the contract.", "\"Citipointe is using their religious beliefs to openly discriminate against queer and trans students, as well as threatening to take away their education,\" The petition states.", "On the petition, a former student and member of the LGBTQIAPKZ+ community said they were \"sickened\" to hear the \"disgusting\" changes to the enrollment contract.", "\"We say we need to change the narrative, but we continue to live in a world that's homophobic. A dystopian nightmare for queers. Why not take that little step to be inclusive? We, together, can make a difference.\"", "The petition has attracted many supporters from around the country.", "\"As a teacher, this is one of the most disturbing act a school could possibly pull. If a school failed to educate students and even failed to provide a safe place to nurture growth in youth. Do they even deserve to call themselves a school?\" One person wrote.", "\"A real Christian loves everyone,\" another person wrote.", "The school's Principal Pastor Brian Mulheran said in a statement the school had always held these Christian beliefs and made the contract to \"be fair and transparent to everyone in our community by making them clear\".", "\"We are seeking to maintain our Christian ethos and to give parents and students the right to make an informed choice about whether they can support and embrace our approach to Christian education,\" Mulheran said.", "\"Citipointe does not judge students on their sexuality or gender identity and we would not make a decision about their enrolment in the College simply on that basis,\" The statement says in contradiction to the contract.", "The principal claims the school \"unequivocally\" loves and respects all people \"regardless of their lifestyle and choices, even if those choices are different to our beliefs and practice\"."]
